wanem_app package¶

Submodules¶

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd module¶

class wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.Bridge_Config_Form(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

Bases: flask_wtf.form.FlaskForm

Flask WTF form to configure the individual bridge interfaces with the TC variables to be used

InputBwBurst = <UnboundField(IntegerField, ('Bandwidth Burst (bytes)',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.Optional object>]})>¶
InputBwLimit = <UnboundField(IntegerField, ('Bandwidth Rate (kbps)',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.Optional object>]})>¶
InputDelayCorrelation = <UnboundField(IntegerField, ('Delay Correlation (%)',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.Optional object>]})>¶
InputDelayDistribution = <UnboundField(SelectField, ('Delay Distribution',), {'choices': [('normal', 'Normal'), ('pareto', 'Pareto'), ('paretonormal', 'Pareto Normal')], 'default': 'Normal'})>¶
InputMeanDelay = <UnboundField(IntegerField, ('Mean Delay (ms)',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.Optional object>]})>¶
InputPktLoss = <UnboundField(DecimalField, ('Packet Loss (%)',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.Optional object>]})>¶
InputPktLossCorrelation = <UnboundField(IntegerField, ('Packet Loss Correlation (%)',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.Optional object>]})>¶
InputStdDev = <UnboundField(IntegerField, ('Standard Deviation (ms)',), {'validators': [<wtforms.validators.Optional object>]})>¶
validate()¶

Validates the form by calling validate on each field, passing any extra Form.validate_<fieldname> validators to the field validator.

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.config()¶

Function to process request to the /config url, in this url you will see a list of all the bridges that can be configured :return: The template render for config.html

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.config_br(br)¶

Function to configure the individual bridges, here you can set the different variables like Bw, rtt, etc… :param br: The bridge number to configure :return: The template render for config_brodge.html if the request type is GET, if the request type is POST then the bridge configuration form is processed and the function returns to the /config url

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.get_bridges()¶

Function to return the bridges and member associations :return: Dictionary with the following format: {‘<#>’:{‘name’:<br_name>, ‘interface_in’:<if_in>, ‘interface_out’:<if_out>}, …}

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.get_interfaces()¶

Function to process the interfaces available on the system :return: if_list: Dictionary with the following format: {‘<if_number>’:{‘name’:<if_name>, ‘status’:<if_status>, ‘ip_addr’:<if_ip_address>}, …}

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.get_tc_status()¶

Function to return the TC status :return: List with all the lines of the command output

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.reset()¶

Function to reset and clear tc configurations from the interfaces :return: redirect to status main.html

wanem_app.WANEm_FrontEnd.status()¶

Function to process requests to the root url, in this url you will find the status on how the system is configured :return: The template render for status.html
